trans-unit.source: Use Hadoop Sqoop in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Use Hadoop Sqoop in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to run Sqoop import and export between a Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight cluster and an Azure SQL database.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to run Sqoop import and export between a Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight cluster and an Azure SQL database.

trans-unit.source: Use Sqoop with Hadoop in HDInsight (SSH)
trans-unit.target: Use Sqoop with Hadoop in HDInsight (SSH)

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Sqoop to import and export between a Linux-based HDInsight cluster and Azure SQL Database or SQL Server database.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Sqoop to import and export between a Linux-based HDInsight cluster and Azure SQL Database or SQL Server database.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The steps in this article use SSH to connect to a Linux-based HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The steps in this article use SSH to connect to a Linux-based HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Windows clients can also use Azure PowerShell to work with Sqoop on Linux-based clusters as documented in [Use Sqoop with Hadoop in HDInsight (PowerShell)](hdinsight-use-sqoop.md).
trans-unit.target: Windows clients can also use Azure PowerShell to work with Sqoop on Linux-based clusters as documented in [Use Sqoop with Hadoop in HDInsight (PowerShell)](hdinsight-use-sqoop.md).

trans-unit.source: What is Sqoop?
trans-unit.target: What is Sqoop?

trans-unit.source: Although Hadoop is a natural choice for processing unstructured and semistructured data, such as logs and files, there may also be a need to process structured data that is stored in relational databases.
trans-unit.target: Although Hadoop is a natural choice for processing unstructured and semistructured data, such as logs and files, there may also be a need to process structured data that is stored in relational databases.

trans-unit.source: [Sqoop][sqoop-user-guide-1.4.4] is a tool designed to transfer data between Hadoop clusters and relational databases.
trans-unit.target: [Sqoop][sqoop-user-guide-1.4.4] is a tool designed to transfer data between Hadoop clusters and relational databases.

trans-unit.source: You can use it to import data from a relational database management system (RDBMS) such as SQL Server, MySQL, or Oracle into the Hadoop distributed file system (HDFS), transform the data in Hadoop with MapReduce or Hive, and then export the data back into an RDBMS.
trans-unit.target: You can use it to import data from a relational database management system (RDBMS) such as SQL Server, MySQL, or Oracle into the Hadoop distributed file system (HDFS), transform the data in Hadoop with MapReduce or Hive, and then export the data back into an RDBMS.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you are using a SQL Server database for your relational database.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you are using a SQL Server database for your relational database.

trans-unit.source: For Sqoop versions that are supported on HDInsight clusters, see [What's new in the cluster versions provided by HDInsight?][hdinsight-versions].
trans-unit.target: For Sqoop versions that are supported on HDInsight clusters, see [What's new in the cluster versions provided by HDInsight?][hdinsight-versions].

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have the following:
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have the following:

trans-unit.source: **Workstation**: A computer with an SSH client.
trans-unit.target: **Workstation**: A computer with an SSH client.

trans-unit.source: **Azure CLI**: For more information, see [Install and Configure the Azure CLI](../xplat-cli.md)
trans-unit.target: **Azure CLI**: For more information, see [Install and Configure the Azure CLI](../xplat-cli.md)

trans-unit.source: **Linux-based HDInsight cluster**: For instructions about cluster provision, see [Get started using HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-tutorial-get-started.md) or [Provision HDInsight clusters][hdinsight-provision].
trans-unit.target: **Linux-based HDInsight cluster**: For instructions about cluster provision, see [Get started using HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-tutorial-get-started.md) or [Provision HDInsight clusters][hdinsight-provision].

trans-unit.source: **Azure SQL database**: This document provides instructions for creating an example SQL database.
trans-unit.target: **Azure SQL database**: This document provides instructions for creating an example SQL database.

trans-unit.source: For more information on SQL Database, see [Get started using Azure SQL database][sqldatabase-get-started].
trans-unit.target: For more information on SQL Database, see [Get started using Azure SQL database][sqldatabase-get-started].

trans-unit.source: **SQL Server**: The steps in this document can also be used, with some modification, with SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: **SQL Server**: The steps in this document can also be used, with some modification, with SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: For more information on requirements specific to using this article with SQL Server, see the [Using SQL Server](#using-sql-server) section.
trans-unit.target: For more information on requirements specific to using this article with SQL Server, see the [Using SQL Server](#using-sql-server) section.

trans-unit.source: Understand the scenario
trans-unit.target: Understand the scenario

trans-unit.source: An HDInsight cluster comes with some sample data.
trans-unit.target: An HDInsight cluster comes with some sample data.

trans-unit.source: You will use a Hive table named **hivesampletable**, which references the data file located at **wasb:///hive/warehouse/hivesampletable**.
trans-unit.target: You will use a Hive table named **hivesampletable**, which references the data file located at **wasb:///hive/warehouse/hivesampletable**.

trans-unit.source: The table contains some mobile device data.
trans-unit.target: The table contains some mobile device data.

trans-unit.source: The Hive table schema is:
trans-unit.target: The Hive table schema is:

trans-unit.source: Field
trans-unit.target: Field

trans-unit.target: Data type

trans-unit.target: clientid

trans-unit.source: string
trans-unit.target: string

trans-unit.source: querytime
trans-unit.target: querytime

trans-unit.source: string
trans-unit.target: string

trans-unit.source: market
trans-unit.target: market

trans-unit.source: string
trans-unit.target: string

trans-unit.source: deviceplatform
trans-unit.target: deviceplatform

trans-unit.source: string
trans-unit.target: string

trans-unit.source: devicemake
trans-unit.target: devicemake

trans-unit.source: string
trans-unit.target: string

trans-unit.target: devicemodel

trans-unit.source: string
trans-unit.target: string

trans-unit.source: state
trans-unit.target: state

trans-unit.source: string
trans-unit.target: string

trans-unit.source: country
trans-unit.target: country

trans-unit.source: string
trans-unit.target: string

trans-unit.source: querydwelltime
trans-unit.target: querydwelltime

trans-unit.source: double
trans-unit.target: double

trans-unit.source: sessionid
trans-unit.target: sessionid

trans-unit.source: bigint
trans-unit.target: bigint

trans-unit.source: sessionpagevieworder
trans-unit.target: sessionpagevieworder

trans-unit.source: bigint
trans-unit.target: bigint

trans-unit.source: You will first export **hivesampletable** to the Azure SQL database or to SQL Server in a table named **mobiledata**, and then import the table back to HDInsight at **wasb:///tutorials/usesqoop/importeddata**.
trans-unit.target: You will first export **hivesampletable** to the Azure SQL database or to SQL Server in a table named **mobiledata**, and then import the table back to HDInsight at **wasb:///tutorials/usesqoop/importeddata**.

trans-unit.source: Create a database
trans-unit.target: Create a database

trans-unit.source: Open a terminal or command prompt and use the following command to create a new Azure SQL Database server:
trans-unit.target: Open a terminal or command prompt and use the following command to create a new Azure SQL Database server:

trans-unit.source: For exmaple, `azure sql server create admin password "West US"`.
trans-unit.target: For exmaple, `azure sql server create admin password "West US"`.

trans-unit.source: When the command completes, you will receive a response similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: When the command completes, you will receive a response similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Note the server name returned by this command.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Note the server name returned by this command.

trans-unit.source: This is the short name of the SQL Database server that was created.
trans-unit.target: This is the short name of the SQL Database server that was created.

trans-unit.source: The fully qualified domain name (FQDN) is **<shortname>.database.windows.net**.
trans-unit.target: The fully qualified domain name (FQDN) is **<shortname>.database.windows.net**.

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to create a database named **sqooptest** on the SQL Database server:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to create a database named **sqooptest** on the SQL Database server:

trans-unit.source: This will return an "OK" message when it completes.
trans-unit.target: This will return an "OK" message when it completes.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you receive an error indicating that you do not have access, you may need to add your client workstation's IP address to the SQL Database firewall using the following command:
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you receive an error indicating that you do not have access, you may need to add your client workstation's IP address to the SQL Database firewall using the following command:

trans-unit.source: Create a table
trans-unit.target: Create a table

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] There are many ways to connect to SQL Database to create a table.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] There are many ways to connect to SQL Database to create a table.

trans-unit.source: The following steps use [FreeTDS](http://www.freetds.org/) from the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: The following steps use [FreeTDS](http://www.freetds.org/) from the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Use SSH to connect to the Linux-based HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Use SSH to connect to the Linux-based HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: The address to use when connecting is `CLUSTERNAME-ssh.azurehdinsight.net` and the port is `22`.
trans-unit.target: The address to use when connecting is `CLUSTERNAME-ssh.azurehdinsight.net` and the port is `22`.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using SSH to connect to HDInsight, see the following documents:
trans-unit.target: For more information on using SSH to connect to HDInsight, see the following documents:

trans-unit.source: **Linux, Unix or OS X clients**: See [Connect to a Linux-based HDInsight cluster from Linux, OS X or Unix](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-unix.md#connect-to-a-linux-based-hdinsight-cluster)
trans-unit.target: **Linux, Unix or OS X clients**: See [Connect to a Linux-based HDInsight cluster from Linux, OS X or Unix](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-unix.md#connect-to-a-linux-based-hdinsight-cluster)

trans-unit.source: **Windows clients**: See [Connect to a Linux-based HDInsight cluster from Windows](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows.md#connect-to-a-linux-based-hdinsight-cluster)
trans-unit.target: **Windows clients**: See [Connect to a Linux-based HDInsight cluster from Windows](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows.md#connect-to-a-linux-based-hdinsight-cluster)

trans-unit.target: At the `1>` prompt, enter the following lines:

trans-unit.target: When the `GO` statement is entered, the previous statements will be evaluated.

trans-unit.source: First, the **mobiledata** table is created, then a clustered index is added to it (required by SQL Database.)
trans-unit.target: First, the **mobiledata** table is created, then a clustered index is added to it (required by SQL Database.)

trans-unit.target: Use the following to verify that the table has been created:

trans-unit.target: You should see output similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: Enter `exit` at the `1>` prompt to exit the tsql utility.
trans-unit.target: Enter `exit` at the `1>` prompt to exit the tsql utility.

trans-unit.source: Sqoop export
trans-unit.target: Sqoop export

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to create a link to the SQL Server JDBC driver from the Sqoop lib directory.
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to create a link to the SQL Server JDBC driver from the Sqoop lib directory.

trans-unit.source: This allows Sqoop to use this driver to talk to SQL Database:
trans-unit.target: This allows Sqoop to use this driver to talk to SQL Database:

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to verify that Sqoop can see your SQL Database:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to verify that Sqoop can see your SQL Database:

trans-unit.source: This should return a list of databases, including the **sqooptest** database that you created earlier.
trans-unit.target: This should return a list of databases, including the **sqooptest** database that you created earlier.

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to export data from **hivesampletable** to the **mobiledata** table:
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to export data from **hivesampletable** to the **mobiledata** table:

trans-unit.source: This instructs Sqoop to connect to SQL Database, to the **sqooptest** database, and export data from the **wasb:///hive/warehouse/hivesampletable** (physical files for the *hivesampletable*,) to the **mobiledata** table.
trans-unit.target: This instructs Sqoop to connect to SQL Database, to the **sqooptest** database, and export data from the **wasb:///hive/warehouse/hivesampletable** (physical files for the *hivesampletable*,) to the **mobiledata** table.

trans-unit.source: After the command completes, use the following to connect to the database using TSQL:
trans-unit.target: After the command completes, use the following to connect to the database using TSQL:

trans-unit.source: Once connected, use the following statements to verify that the data was exported to the **mobiledata** table:
trans-unit.target: Once connected, use the following statements to verify that the data was exported to the **mobiledata** table:

trans-unit.source: You should see a listing of data in the table.
trans-unit.target: You should see a listing of data in the table.

trans-unit.source: Type `exit` to exit the tsql utility.
trans-unit.target: Type `exit` to exit the tsql utility.

trans-unit.source: Sqoop import
trans-unit.target: Sqoop import

trans-unit.source: Use the following to import data from the **mobiledata** table in SQL Database, to the **wasb:///tutorials/usesqoop/importeddata** directory on HDInsight:
trans-unit.target: Use the following to import data from the **mobiledata** table in SQL Database, to the **wasb:///tutorials/usesqoop/importeddata** directory on HDInsight:

trans-unit.source: The imported data will have fields that are separated by a tab character, and the lines will be terminated by a new-line character.
trans-unit.target: The imported data will have fields that are separated by a tab character, and the lines will be terminated by a new-line character.

trans-unit.source: Once the import has completed, use the following command to list out the data in the new directory:
trans-unit.target: Once the import has completed, use the following command to list out the data in the new directory:

trans-unit.source: Using SQL Server
trans-unit.target: Using SQL Server

trans-unit.source: You can also use Sqoop to import and export data from SQL Server, either in your data center or on a Virtual Machine hosted in Azure.
trans-unit.target: You can also use Sqoop to import and export data from SQL Server, either in your data center or on a Virtual Machine hosted in Azure.

trans-unit.source: The differences between using SQL Database and SQL Server are:
trans-unit.target: The differences between using SQL Database and SQL Server are:

trans-unit.source: Both HDInsight and the SQL Server must be on the same Azure Virtual Network
trans-unit.target: Both HDInsight and the SQL Server must be on the same Azure Virtual Network

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] HDInsight supports only location-based virtual networks, and it does not currently work with affinity group-based virtual networks.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] HDInsight supports only location-based virtual networks, and it does not currently work with affinity group-based virtual networks.

trans-unit.source: When you are using SQL Server in your datacenter, you must configure the virtual network as *site-to-site* or *point-to-site*.
trans-unit.target: When you are using SQL Server in your datacenter, you must configure the virtual network as *site-to-site* or *point-to-site*.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] For **point-to-site** virtual networks, SQL Server must be running the VPN client configuration application, which is available from the **Dashboard** of your Azure virtual network configuration.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] For **point-to-site** virtual networks, SQL Server must be running the VPN client configuration application, which is available from the **Dashboard** of your Azure virtual network configuration.

trans-unit.source: For more information on creating and configuring a virtual network, see [Virtual Network Configuration Tasks](../services/virtual-machines/).
trans-unit.target: For more information on creating and configuring a virtual network, see [Virtual Network Configuration Tasks](../services/virtual-machines/).

trans-unit.source: SQL Server must be configured to allow SQL authentication.
trans-unit.target: SQL Server must be configured to allow SQL authentication.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Choose an Authentication Mode](https://msdn.microsoft.com/ms144284.aspx)
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Choose an Authentication Mode](https://msdn.microsoft.com/ms144284.aspx)

trans-unit.source: You may have to configure SQL Server to accept remote connections.
trans-unit.target: You may have to configure SQL Server to accept remote connections.

trans-unit.source: See [How to troubleshoot connecting to the SQL Server database engine](http://social.technet.microsoft.com/wiki/contents/articles/2102.how-to-troubleshoot-connecting-to-the-sql-server-database-engine.aspx) for more information
trans-unit.target: See [How to troubleshoot connecting to the SQL Server database engine](http://social.technet.microsoft.com/wiki/contents/articles/2102.how-to-troubleshoot-connecting-to-the-sql-server-database-engine.aspx) for more information

trans-unit.source: You must create the **sqooptest** database in SQL Server using a utility such as **SQL Server Management Studio** or **tsql** - the steps for using the Azure CLI only work for Azure SQL Database
trans-unit.target: You must create the **sqooptest** database in SQL Server using a utility such as **SQL Server Management Studio** or **tsql** - the steps for using the Azure CLI only work for Azure SQL Database

trans-unit.source: The TSQL statements to create the **mobiledata** table are similar those used for SQL Database, with the exception of creating a clusterd index - this is not required for SQL Server:
trans-unit.target: The TSQL statements to create the **mobiledata** table are similar those used for SQL Database, with the exception of creating a clusterd index - this is not required for SQL Server:

trans-unit.source: When connecting to the SQL Server from HDInsight, you may have to use the IP address of the SQL Server unless you have configured a Domain Name System (DNS) to resolve names on the Azure Virtual Network.
trans-unit.target: When connecting to the SQL Server from HDInsight, you may have to use the IP address of the SQL Server unless you have configured a Domain Name System (DNS) to resolve names on the Azure Virtual Network.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Now you have learned how to use Sqoop.
trans-unit.target: Now you have learned how to use Sqoop.

trans-unit.target: To learn more, see:

trans-unit.target: [Use Oozie with HDInsight][hdinsight-use-oozie]: Use Sqoop action in an Oozie workflow.

trans-unit.source: [Analyze flight delay data using HDInsight][hdinsight-analyze-flight-data]: Use Hive to analyze flight delay data, and then use Sqoop to export data to an Azure SQL database.
trans-unit.target: [Analyze flight delay data using HDInsight][hdinsight-analyze-flight-data]: Use Hive to analyze flight delay data, and then use Sqoop to export data to an Azure SQL database.

trans-unit.source: [Upload data to HDInsight][hdinsight-upload-data]: Find other methods for uploading data to HDInsight/Azure Blob storage.
trans-unit.target: [Upload data to HDInsight][hdinsight-upload-data]: Find other methods for uploading data to HDInsight/Azure Blob storage.
